content.description: Start in two finger pocket and sloping crimp move up right to a weird crimpy sloping edge and than a powerful throw up left to the top. Super lowball but surprisingly hard and fun.
content.location: This is on the right hand wall of the corridor across from randy lahey

content.description: Same start as solitude except make your way up the left arête and topout
content.location: Same start as solitude, easy downclimbs on both ends of the face

content.description: Start matched low in small cave make your way out using some cool bike moves and make a few powerful moves to a hard mantle
content.location: Starts in the small cave located on the far left side of the solitude face

content.description: Start compressed on low block and slap your way up the arête. Some of the best quality rock in the park and an instant classic in my opinion.
content.location: This makes its way up the obvious arête toward the middle of the wall. Starts compressed on the two lowest blocks.

content.description: Fun warm up to the right of solitude follow cracks up, there are tons of fun variations
content.protection: Pad for a few larger rocks
content.location: Just to the right of solitude starting in the splitter crack

content.description: Short and sweet face climb into a mantle topout. Start on two incut crimpers in the horizonal and move up to big slotted jug. Hike up the feet and go for the top! For full value, avoid using the low shelf for feet
content.location: 5 or 10 feet to the left of the Solitude arete

content.description: Start on large black left of solitude and dyno up to another large block and top out. Super fun
content.location: Just to the left of solitude

content.description: Fun face climb with a tricky mantle topout. Start low on staggered incut crimps, move up and right on good holds to a small three finger sidepull out right. Stand on the ledge and mantle your way up and over! For full value, avoid using the low shelf for feet
content.location: First route on the left in the bottom of the chamber proper. Look for the rusty barbed wire hanging down. 15 feet left of Rainmaker

content.description: A narrow cleft, just off the Forest Management Trail.
